name: Hotfix: safe field length for keys
Hotfix for: message with two different registration_id arrive to the same device #169
FCM API v1
body:
- Removes dependency on pyFCM
- Uses the new FCM API
- Will require some migration work from <1.0.0, see README for instructions
- Drops support for python < 3 & django < 2.2

name: Last release using the legacy FCM API
Translations, tastypie
body:
- Add translations for model and app
- Fix tastypie imports

name: Bugfixes
body:
- id field for FCMDeviceSerializer made read_only
- default active bug in DRF views

name: Django 1.7 support, Allow re-registration with same id if inactive, add json_encoder parameter for pyfcm
Send data message function added, updated pyfcm
Add option to use multiple FCM keys
Pass all parameters to pyfcm and update its version
Bugfix: updating of device owned by multiple users
Update pyfcm, fix error when sending to inactive devices only
Device pruning
body: Automatically mark inactive devices as inactive and don't send messages to them anymore

name: Prepare for prune devices, pass kwargs

body: Allow passing additional parameters via kwargs to pyfcm's notify_single_device and notify_multiple_devices methods.
If using FCMAuthorizedDeviceViewset, registration_id needs to be unique in pair with the user, not on its own

- add option to send either notifications or data messages
- add django admin commands for testing data messages
- add option to send icon with notification
